channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: LIVE updates: COVID-19 and extended quarantine in the Philippines
item.author: PhilstarLIVE
item.description: The latest updates on the spread of the novel coronavirus in the Philippines and enhanced community quarantine of economic center of Metro Manila and other areas across the country.

item.title: ‘Government needs to strengthen tech-voc, skills training’
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go urged the government to reinforce technical and vocational education as well as skills training programs to help jobseekers after the COVID-19 crisis is over.

item.title: ‘Government must allocate budget for COVID-19 vaccine’
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: An ounce of prevention will always be better than a pound of cure, according to a lawmaker, who said the national government should set aside a certain amount of funds to be used for a vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 in order to save more lives, supposing the medicine will indeed be out 18 months from now.

item.title: OWWA needs P2.5 billion for 45,000 returning OFWs
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The Overseas Workers Welfare Administration (OWWA) needs P2.5 billion to provide accommodation and other assistance for 45,000 returning displaced overseas Filipino workers.

item.title: House threatens NTC execs with contempt
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: The House committee on legislative franchise wants officials of the National Telecommunications Commission cited for contempt if they fail to explain satisfactorily their reason for ordering ABS-CBN to shut down.

item.title: DPWH, Villar Group build mobile rooms at CCP complex
item.description: Shipping containers purpose-built by the Department of Public Works and Highways and Villar Group of Companies into mobile rooms have been deployed at the Cultural Center of the Philippines complex in Pasay City.

item.title: Travel group waits for new normal
item.author: Ghio Ong
item.description: With strict stay-at-home orders imposed in almost all corners of the world due to the growing threat of the coronavirus disease 2019, there is no certainty yet when or if people can travel again.

item.title: Task Force approves safety guidelines for construction work
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government has approved the safety guidelines for implementing infrastructure projects in areas under enhanced or general community quarantine.

item.title: Palace to churches: Present distancing plans
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: Malacañang yesterday urged religious groups to coordinate with local government units and to present proposals on how to observe safe physical distancing in places of worship.

item.title: Ambo brings relief to scorched Metro Manila
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Rains from Tropical Depression Ambo will slightly bring down temperatures in Metro Manila this weekend, according to the state weather bureau.
